sentences.english: Such was the coarse language of this bad, neglected boy.
sentences.chinese: 那個沒教養的壞孩子吉姆說起話來就是這麼粗俗。

sentences.english: Dyogot. 'Sexiness was not allowed. It was considered vulgar.
sentences.chinese: 性感是不允許的，會被人認爲是粗俗。

sentences.english: Amy: I don't know about you, but I find skinny-dipping and streaking quite vulgar.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道你怎麼看，但我覺得裸泳和裸奔都挺粗俗的。

sentences.english: It's dirty and has an uncouth culture.
sentences.chinese: 那裏髒兮兮的，文化又粗俗。

sentences.english: What do you think of the story about Mr. Wedgwood and how he responded to the nobleman's harsh talk?
sentences.chinese: 你對威基伍先生迴應那貴族粗俗言語的方式有何看法？

sentences.english: She is a temperamental person and likes to make tasteless jokes.
sentences.chinese: 她是個喜怒無常的人，而且喜歡開粗俗的玩笑。

sentences.english: We should purify the language of barbarisms.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該消除語言中的粗俗語句。

sentences.english: Pardon my French, they are complete garbage.
sentences.chinese: 原諒我的粗俗，它們完全是垃圾。

sentences.english: The letters spelled a rather rude word.
sentences.chinese: 這些字母拼成了一個特別粗俗的單詞。

sentences.english: Are you so much afraid, then, of being vulgar?
sentences.chinese: 這麼說，你是很害怕粗俗了？

sentences.english: A: Don’t embarrass3 me at the party tonight with your off-color jokes.
sentences.chinese: 別在今天的晚會上說你那些粗俗的笑話讓我沒面子。
每一個動作都透露著粗俗。

sentences.english: Most of the valentine cards either had hearts on them or were very rude.
sentences.chinese: 大多數的情人卡要麼上面有一顆心，要麼非常粗俗。

sentences.english: Vulgarity is the ugliest word in our language.
sentences.chinese: 粗俗是我們言語中最醜的一個詞。

sentences.english: The club was so low-brow I was shocked.
sentences.chinese: 我被這傢俱樂部的粗俗氛圍感到震驚。

definition: lower course of a river/low-class/mean and lowly/vulgar/obscene
unkind/harsh/cutting/mean/acrimony/to embezzle by making illegal deductions
